thread.title: ‘The Roger Kahn Reader’ Review: The Joys of Summer

author: Edward Kosner
title: ‘The Roger Kahn Reader’ Review: The Joys of Summer
text:
‘Old School’ is one of the more irritating pet expressions in today’s vocabulary. Garroting on “The Sopranos” is old school. So is hitting behind the runner in baseball and the fastidious serial Oxford comma. When appropriately applied, however, it can be a term of honor: Roger Kahn, the great sportswriter, is old school—and proud of it. Indeed, the Roger Kahn Old School of Sports Journalism should be established in his name.
Mr. Kahn has written 20 books, including two novels. But he is best known for the title of one of...
